title: Jambon-Wrapped Grilled Endive
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Jambon-Wrapped Grilled Endive a try. For 69 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 1g of protein, 15g of fat, and a total of 139 calories. This recipe serves 3. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly diet. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. Head to the store and pick up belgian endive, walnut halves, lemon wedges, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 25%, this dish is rather bad. Similar recipes are Endive En Jambon (Endive Round-up and Giveaway!), Warm Pancetta-wrapped Endive Salad, and Prosciutto Wrapped Endive W/ Balsamic Fig Reduction - Rachael Ra.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat a grill pan on medium.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Drizzle each endive half lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.  Wrap each half in one slice of ham.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Grill the endive 5 minutes per side, until the endive starts to become tender and the ham crisp.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Drizzle the warm endive with olive oil, and serve with walnut halves.  Squeeze lemon wedges and serve right away.

steps.step: Preheat a grill pan on medium.
Drizzle each endive half lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.  Wrap each half in one slice of ham.
Grill the endive 5 minutes per side, until the endive starts to become tender and the ham crisp.
Drizzle the warm endive with olive oil, and serve with walnut halves.  Squeeze lemon wedges and serve right away.
